sentence.Network_en: They are showing a marked disinclination to pursue these opportunities.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们对争取这些机会明显表现出不乐意。

sentence.Network_en: There was a general disinclination to return to the office after lunch.
sentence.Network_cn: 午饭后人们一般都懒得回办公室办公。

sentence.Network_en: I'm afraid I have quite a disinclination to retire on a pension.
sentence.Network_cn: 恐怕我很不愿意领养老金退休.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 蓝宝词典 ... disguise v. 伪装，掩饰 disinclination n. 不起劲，不感兴趣，厌恶 disinfect vt. 消毒.
to throw into disorder or disarraydisinclination n. 不起劲,不感兴趣,厌恶a preference for avoiding something:slight aversio.

list.abs: They were usually disinclined to socialize ., 通常他们不愿参加社交.
Is disinclined to explain ., 是不愿作出解释.
That reflects a very British disinclination shell out on management training ., 这反映出英国人非常不喜欢花钱进行管理培训.
Well , iI feel rather disincline to talk about the accident ., 嗯 , 我觉得很不愿意谈这事故.

entry.def: A disinclination to do something is a feeling that you do not want to do it.

example.ex: They are showing a marked disinclination to pursue these opportunities.
example.tran: 他们对争取这些机会明显表现出不乐意。

means.word_mean: 1. that toward which you are inclined to feel dislike;

sentences.sentence: "his disinclination for modesty is well known"

auth_sentence.content: Some people remain single out of a disinclination to settle.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some people remain single out of a disinclination to settle.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some people remain single out of a disinclination to settle.

auth_sentence.content: Goya was a renowned portrait painter, especially for royalty and his work was noted for his disinclination to flatter.
auth_sentence.res_content: Goya was a renowned portrait painter, especially for royalty and his work was noted for his disinclination to flatter.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Goya was a renowned portrait painter, especially for royalty and his work was noted for his disinclination to flatter.

auth_sentence.content: Favorability or disinclination may be all that we are talking about yet, and these may have extraneous reasons.
auth_sentence.res_content: Favorability or disinclination may be all that we are talking about yet, and these may have extraneous reasons.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Favorability or disinclination may be all that we are talking about yet, and these may have extraneous reasons.

sentences.en: He has a disinclination for work.
He felt a disinclination to take music lessons.
I’m afraid I have quite a disinclination to retire on a pension.
sentences.cn: 恐怕我很不愿意领养老金退休。
